clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Bottle-PEP in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Bottle-PEP in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The effectiveness of Bottle PEP in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

primary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in the first minute
primary_outcome.description: Pulmonary function tests that are done with a spirometry to measure forced expiratory volume

secondary_outcome.description: 6 minute walking test is a field test that measures the distance a patient walks during a 6 minute period.

secondary_outcome.measure: St. George's Quality of Life Score
secondary_outcome.description: Scores are calculated for three domains: Symptoms, Activity and Impacts (Psycho-social) as well as a total score. Psychometric testing has demonstrated its repeatability, reliability and validity. Sensitivity has been demonstrated in clinical trials. A minimum change in score of 4 units was established as clinically relevant after patient and clinician testing. This score has been used in a range of disease groups including asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and bronchiectasis, and in a range of settings such as randomised controlled therapy trials and population surveys.

arm_group.description: Bottle PEP is a positive expiratory system that is applied via a tube of more than 5 mm of thickness and a bottle filled with water about 10 cms.

intervention.description: Positive expiratory device with a bottle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with COPD
- Stable Disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neuromuscular disease
- Recent pneumothorax
- Major surgery in the last 6 months
